articles.title: Majority jury verdicts: common sense or bad justice? - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: As America insists on unanimous jury verdicts, New Zealand persists with a system some say is unsafe.
articles.content: As America moves to allow only unanimous jury verdicts, questions are being asked why New Zealand continues to permit majority decisions. Mike White investigates whether majority verdicts have improv… [+15851 chars]

articles.title: Pregnant California woman abandoned by Biden in Afghanistan says Taliban are hunting Americans - Daily Mail
articles.description: Pregnant California native Nafisa, 25, says she remains trapped in Afghanistan after the US pullout from the country. She says that the Taliban are going door to door, looking for Americans.
articles.content:

articles.title: Unemployment benefits expire for 7 million Americans, pressuring families and the economy - The Washington Post
articles.description: Federal funds meant to ease the economic shock of the pandemic are coming to an end. “It just feels like being discarded,” one worker said.

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: 'Players will explode' - Busquets warns against burnout amid proposal to hold World Cup every two years - Goal India
articles.description: Lionel Messi's Argentina and Neymar's Brazil are leading South American qualifying for the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. The top four qualify directly and the fifth-place team will qualify for a playoff.
